result.markdown:
---
title: "06 - Multilevel models I"
author: "Stefano Coretta"
format:
  mono-light-revealjs:
    theme: [default, custom.scss]
    history: false
filters:
  - tachyonsextra
execute:
  echo: true
knitr:
  opts_chunk: 
    fig-align: center
---




## Set order of levels


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
token_measures <- token_measures |> 
  mutate(
    c2_phonation = factor(c2_phonation, levels = c("voiceless", "voiced"))
  )
```
:::


## Multilevel terms


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
get_prior(
  v1_duration ~
    0 + c2_phonation:language + s(speech_rate_c, k = 3) +
    (0 + c2_phonation | speaker),
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal
)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                prior class                                  coef   group resp
               (flat)     b                                                   
               (flat)     b    c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian             
               (flat)     b     c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish             
               (flat)     b c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian             
               (flat)     b  c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish             
               (flat)     b                      sspeech_rate_c_1             
               lkj(1)   cor                                                   
               lkj(1)   cor                                       speaker     
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5)    sd                                                   
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5)    sd                                       speaker     
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5)    sd                    c2_phonationvoiced speaker     
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5)    sd                 c2_phonationvoiceless speaker     
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5)   sds                                                   
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5)   sds               s(speech_rate_c, k = 3)             
 student_t(3, 0, 2.5) sigma                                                   
 dpar nlpar lb ub       source
                       default
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                  (vectorized)
                       default
                  (vectorized)
             0         default
             0    (vectorized)
             0    (vectorized)
             0    (vectorized)
             0         default
             0    (vectorized)
             0         default
```


:::
:::

## Model priors


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
m_7_priors <- c(
  prior(normal(4.45, 0.55), class = b),
  prior(normal(0, 0.5), class = b, coef = sspeech_rate_c_1),
  prior(normal(0, 0.1), class = sigma),
  prior(normal(0, 0.1), class = sd),
  prior(normal(0, 0.1), class = sds),
  prior(lkj(2), class = cor)
)
```
:::


## Fit model


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
m_7 <- brm(
  v1_duration ~
    0 + c2_phonation:language + s(speech_rate_c, k = 3) +
    (0 + c2_phonation | speaker),
  data = token_measures,
  family = lognormal,
  prior = m_7_priors,
  seed = my_seed,
  cores = 4,
  file = "data/cache/m_7"
)
```
:::


## Model summary


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(m_7, prob = 0.8)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 Family: lognormal 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = identity 
Formula: v1_duration ~ 0 + c2_phonation:language + s(speech_rate_c, k = 3) + (0 + c2_phonation | speaker) 
   Data: token_measures (Number of observations: 1342) 
  Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup draws = 4000

Smoothing Spline Hyperparameters:
                      Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS
sds(sspeech_rate_c_1)     0.19      0.07     0.10     0.28 1.00     2931
                      Tail_ESS
sds(sspeech_rate_c_1)     1370

Multilevel Hyperparameters:
~speaker (Number of levels: 17) 
                                              Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI
sd(c2_phonationvoiceless)                         0.13      0.02     0.10
sd(c2_phonationvoiced)                            0.13      0.02     0.10
cor(c2_phonationvoiceless,c2_phonationvoiced)     0.82      0.11     0.68
                                              u-80% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sd(c2_phonationvoiceless)                         0.15 1.00     2032     2466
sd(c2_phonationvoiced)                            0.15 1.00     1803     2185
cor(c2_phonationvoiceless,c2_phonationvoiced)     0.93 1.00     1754     2381

Regression Coefficients:
                                      Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat
c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian     4.62      0.04     4.58     4.67 1.00
c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian        4.73      0.04     4.69     4.78 1.00
c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish      4.33      0.05     4.27     4.40 1.00
c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish         4.43      0.05     4.36     4.49 1.00
sspeech_rate_c_1                         -0.09      0.01    -0.11    -0.08 1.00
                                      Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
c2_phonationvoiceless:languageItalian     1049     1783
c2_phonationvoiced:languageItalian        1302     1834
c2_phonationvoiceless:languagePolish      1464     2120
c2_phonationvoiced:languagePolish         1578     1974
sspeech_rate_c_1                          4845     3154

Further Distributional Parameters:
      Estimate Est.Error l-80% CI u-80% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sigma     0.19      0.00     0.19     0.20 1.00     8021     3058

Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
```


:::
:::


## Posterior probability distribution: outcome


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
conditional_effects(m_7, effects = "language:c2_phonation")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](06_multilevel_1_files/figure-revealjs/m-7-cond-1-1.png){fig-align='center' width=960}
:::
:::


## Posterior probability distribution: difference of difference


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_comparisons(m_7, variables = "c2_phonation", by = "language", conf_level = 0.8, comparison = "ratio")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

         Term                       Contrast language Estimate 10.0 % 90.0 %
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) / mean(voiceless)  Italian     1.12   1.10   1.13
 c2_phonation mean(voiced) / mean(voiceless)  Polish      1.10   1.07   1.12

Columns: term, contrast, language, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, predicted_lo, predicted_hi, predicted, tmp_idx 
Type:  response 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_comparisons(m_7, variables = "c2_phonation", by = "language", conf_level = 0.8, comparison = "ratio", hypothesis = "b2 = b1")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

  Term Estimate  10.0 % 90.0 %
 b2=b1  -0.0163 -0.0489 0.0148

Columns: term, estimate, conf.low, conf.high 
Type:  response 
```


:::
:::


## Spread draws


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
gather_draws(m_7, r_speaker[speaker,term])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 136,000 × 7
# Groups:   speaker, term, .variable [34]
   speaker term               .chain .iteration .draw .variable .value
   <chr>   <chr>               <int>      <int> <int> <chr>      <dbl>
 1 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          1     1 r_speaker 0.133 
 2 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          2     2 r_speaker 0.0872
 3 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          3     3 r_speaker 0.109 
 4 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          4     4 r_speaker 0.0909
 5 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          5     5 r_speaker 0.143 
 6 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          6     6 r_speaker 0.0633
 7 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          7     7 r_speaker 0.137 
 8 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          8     8 r_speaker 0.0637
 9 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1          9     9 r_speaker 0.104 
10 it01    c2_phonationvoiced      1         10    10 r_speaker 0.0409
# ℹ 135,990 more rows
```


:::
:::



## Forest plot


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
gather_draws(m_7, r_speaker[speaker,term]) |> 
  ggplot(aes(.value, reorder(speaker, .value))) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0) +
  stat_halfeye() +
  facet_grid(cols = vars(term))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](06_multilevel_1_files/figure-revealjs/forest-1-1.png){fig-align='center' width=960}
:::
:::


## Calculate posterior draws for each participant


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
m_7_grid <- token_measures |> 
  distinct(speaker, language, c2_phonation) |> 
  mutate(
    speech_rate_c = 0
  )

m_7_epred <- epred_draws(m_7, m_7_grid)
m_7_epred
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 136,000 × 9
# Groups:   speaker, language, c2_phonation, speech_rate_c, .row [34]
   speaker language c2_phonation speech_rate_c  .row .chain .iteration .draw
   <chr>   <chr>    <fct>                <dbl> <int>  <int>      <int> <int>
 1 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     1
 2 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     2
 3 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     3
 4 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     4
 5 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     5
 6 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     6
 7 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     7
 8 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     8
 9 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA     9
10 it01    Italian  voiced                   0     1     NA         NA    10
# ℹ 135,990 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: .epred <dbl>
```


:::
:::


## Calculate posterior difference


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
m_7_epred_diff <- m_7_epred |> 
  ungroup() |> 
  select(-.row) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = c2_phonation, values_from = .epred) |> 
  mutate(
    diff = voiced - voiceless
  )

m_7_epred_diff
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 68,000 × 9
   speaker language speech_rate_c .chain .iteration .draw voiced voiceless  diff
   <chr>   <chr>            <dbl>  <int>      <int> <int>  <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>
 1 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     1   126.      114. 12.1 
 2 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     2   122.      116.  6.43
 3 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     3   131.      113. 17.5 
 4 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     4   124.      113. 11.6 
 5 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     5   128.      117. 10.7 
 6 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     6   124.      118.  6.37
 7 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     7   127.      115. 12.2 
 8 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     8   124.      117.  7.19
 9 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA     9   130.      113. 16.7 
10 it01    Italian              0     NA         NA    10   120.      116.  3.58
# ℹ 67,990 more rows
```


:::
:::


## Plot posterior difference by speaker


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](06_multilevel_1_files/figure-revealjs/diff-plot-1.png){fig-align='center' width=960}
:::
:::


## What about different vowels?


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
token_measures |> 
  ggplot(aes(c2_phonation, v1_duration)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1, alpha = 0.2) +
  facet_grid(rows = vars(vowel), cols = vars(language))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](06_multilevel_1_files/figure-revealjs/vdur-vow-1.png){fig-align='center' width=960}
:::
:::


## You try it! {background-color=var(--inverse)}

A hint

```r
v1_duration ~
    0 + c2_phonation:vowel:language + s(speech_rate_c, k = 3) +
    (0 + c2_phonation:vowel | speaker)
```

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
